laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is slightly increased in echogenicity which may reflect fatty infiltration. There are no focal lesions. There is no intrahepatic duct dilation. The CBD is increased in diameter measuring 6 mm, previously 3 mm. The gallbladder contains numerous echogenic shadowing stones. There is increasing wall thickening up to 4 mm but no distension and no pericholecystic fluid. Visualized portions of the pancreatic head and body are normal without focal lesions or duct dilation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CBD diameter increased from 3 mm to 6 mm.
